text:
League 1
Nantes: Christian Gourcuff opens the door to Hatem Ben Arfa
In a press conference on Friday, FC Nantes coach Christian Gourcuff spoke about the Canaris' interest in Hatem Ben Arfa.
01 Nov 2019, 15:20 by Florian Sermaise



FC Nantes FC Nantes aims to finish in the first part of the table after a twelfth place finish in the previous year.Icon Sport



Alban LafontIcon Sport



Mehdi AbeidIcon Sport




Icon Sport




Nicolas PalloisIcon Sport



Lucas LimaIcon Sport



Andrei GirottoIcon Sport



Abdoulaye ToureIcon Sport



Valentin RongierIcon Sport



Yassine El GhanassyIcon Sport



Samuel MoutoussamyIcon Sport



Kalifa CoulibalyIcon Sport

Nantes: the possible eleven




When one door closes, another one becomes ajar. While OGC Nice coach Patrick Vieira has apparently closed the possibility of Hatem Ben Arfa's return to the French Riviera at a press conference on Friday afternoon, his FC counterpart Nantes Christian Gourcuff has, at the same time, hinted a window of fire for the arrival of the left-handed in Loire-Atlantique.




"If players want to join us, I do not have to have rejections"




Hatem Ben Arfa + 12 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

"I will not comment on the rumors," began Christian Gourcuff, before continuing: "We pretend to have a project, a priori if players want to join us, I do not have to have rejections. have no problem communicating with the club management. " Yesterday, the daily L'Equipe mentioned just an interest from the leaders of Nantes Hatem Ben Arfa, free since his departure from Stade Rennais this summer. The latter could rebound to the rival of the Bretons.
